properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 3 at 1:16PM MST until February 4 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY
AFTERNOON...

* WHAT...Blizzard conditions through tonight. Snow, heavy at
times. Total snowfall accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds
gusting up to 55 mph.

* WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM to 11 AM MST
Tuesday. For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 AM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. Strong
winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as
25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY
